Structure Internals.h

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 #ifndef __STRUCTURE_INTERNAL_H
00002 #define __STRUCTURE_INTERNAL_H
00003 
00004 // 
00005 // If you wish to use the structure database functions, include 
00006 // structure_extern.h, not structure.h! 
00007 //
00008 
00009 #include "types.h"
00010 #include "himage.h"
00011 
00012 // A few words about the overall structure scheme:
00013 //
00014 // Large structures are split into multiple sections,
00015 // one for each tile.
00016 // 
00017 // Each section is treated as a separate object,
00018 // except that it does NOT record information about
00019 // hit points, but instead stores a pointer to the
00020 // base object (section).
00021 //
00022 // Each section has a line of sight profile.  These
00023 // profiles are split into 5 in each horizontal direction
00024 // and 4 vertically, forming 100 "cubes".  In real
00025 // world terms, each section represents a volume
00026 // with a height of 8 feet (and width and length
00027 // of what?)
00028 //
00029 // It is important to note that the vertical
00030 // position of each section is measured in individual
00031 // cubes (rather than, as it were, groups of 4 vertical
00032 // cubes)
00033 
00034 #define PROFILE_X_SIZE 5
00035 #define PROFILE_Y_SIZE 5
00036 #define PROFILE_Z_SIZE 4
00037 
00038 // these values should be compared for less than rather than less
00039 // than or equal to
00040 #define STRUCTURE_ON_GROUND 0
00041 #define STRUCTURE_ON_ROOF PROFILE_Z_SIZE
00042 #define STRUCTURE_ON_GROUND_MAX PROFILE_Z_SIZE
00043 #define STRUCTURE_ON_ROOF_MAX PROFILE_Z_SIZE * 2
00044 
00045 typedef UINT8 PROFILE[PROFILE_X_SIZE][PROFILE_Y_SIZE];
00046 
00047 extern UINT8 AtHeight[PROFILE_Z_SIZE];
00048 
00049 // MAP_ELEMENT may get later:
00050 // PROFILE *            CombinedLOSProfile;
00051 // PROFILE *            CombinedProtectionProfile;
00052 //
00053 // LEVELNODE gets a pointer to a STRUCTURE or
00054 // a union between its soldier pointer and a
00055 // STRUCTURE pointer
00056 
00057 // if (fFlags & STRUCTURE_BASE_TILE)
00058 // then the structure is the "base" of the object
00059 // and its hitpoint value is the one for the object
00060 //
00061 //                                                                                                vv    generic flags for all structures
00062 //                                                                                             vvv      type flags
00063 //
00064 
00065 // how to handle explodable structures
00066 
00067 // NOT used in DB structures!
00068 #define STRUCTURE_BASE_TILE               0x00000001
00069 #define STRUCTURE_OPEN                          0x00000002
00070 #define STRUCTURE_OPENABLE                0x00000004
00071 // synonyms for STRUCTURE_OPENABLE
00072 #define STRUCTURE_CLOSEABLE               0x00000004
00073 #define STRUCTURE_SEARCHABLE        0x00000004
00074 #define STRUCTURE_HIDDEN                        0x00000008
00075 
00076 #define STRUCTURE_MOBILE                        0x00000010
00077 // STRUCTURE_PASSABLE is set for each structure instance where
00078 // the tile flag TILE_PASSABLE is set
00079 #define STRUCTURE_PASSABLE                0x00000020
00080 #define STRUCTURE_EXPLOSIVE               0x00000040
00081 #define STRUCTURE_TRANSPARENT       0x00000080
00082 
00083 #define STRUCTURE_GENERIC                       0x00000100
00084 #define STRUCTURE_TREE                          0x00000200
00085 #define STRUCTURE_FENCE                         0x00000400
00086 #define STRUCTURE_WIREFENCE               0x00000800
00087 
00088 #define STRUCTURE_HASITEMONTOP      0x00001000              // ATE: HASITEM: struct has item on top of it
00089 #define STRUCTURE_SPECIAL                       0x00002000
00090 #define STRUCTURE_LIGHTSOURCE       0x00004000
00091 #define STRUCTURE_VEHICLE                       0x00008000
00092 
00093 #define STRUCTURE_WALL                          0x00010000
00094 #define STRUCTURE_WALLNWINDOW       0x00020000
00095 #define STRUCTURE_SLIDINGDOOR       0x00040000
00096 #define STRUCTURE_DOOR                          0x00080000
00097 
00098 // a "multi" structure (as opposed to multitiled) is composed of multiple graphics & structures
00099 #define STRUCTURE_MULTI                         0x00100000
00100 #define STRUCTURE_CAVEWALL                0x00200000
00101 #define STRUCTURE_DDOOR_LEFT        0x00400000
00102 #define STRUCTURE_DDOOR_RIGHT       0x00800000
00103 
00104 #define STRUCTURE_NORMAL_ROOF       0x01000000
00105 #define STRUCTURE_SLANTED_ROOF      0x02000000
00106 #define STRUCTURE_TALL_ROOF               0x04000000
00107 #define STRUCTURE_SWITCH                        0x08000000
00108 
00109 #define STRUCTURE_ON_LEFT_WALL      0x10000000
00110 #define STRUCTURE_ON_RIGHT_WALL     0x20000000
00111 #define STRUCTURE_CORPSE                        0x40000000
00112 #define STRUCTURE_PERSON                        0x80000000
00113 
00114 // COMBINATION FLAGS
00115 #define STRUCTURE_ANYFENCE                0x00000C00
00116 #define STRUCTURE_ANYDOOR                       0x00CC0000
00117 #define STRUCTURE_OBSTACLE                0x00008F00
00118 #define STRUCTURE_WALLSTUFF               0x00CF0000
00119 #define STRUCTURE_BLOCKSMOVES   0x00208F00
00120 #define STRUCTURE_TYPE_DEFINED      0x8FEF8F00
00121 #define STRUCTURE_ROOF          0x07000000
00122 
00123 #define TILE_ON_ROOF                                  0x01
00124 #define TILE_PASSABLE                                 0x02
00125 
00126 typedef struct TAG_STRUCTURE_TILE
00127 {
00128       INT16             sPosRelToBase;  // "single-axis"
00129       INT8              bXPosRelToBase;
00130       INT8              bYPosRelToBase;
00131       PROFILE           Shape;                              // 25 bytes
00132       UINT8             fFlags;
00133       UINT8             ubVehicleHitLocation;
00134       BYTE              bUnused[1];
00135 } DB_STRUCTURE_TILE; // 32 bytes
00136 
00137 #define BASE_TILE 0
00138 
00139 #define NO_PARTNER_STRUCTURE 0
00140 
00141 typedef struct TAG_DB_STRUCTURE
00142 {
00143       UINT8                                           ubArmour;
00144       UINT8                                           ubHitPoints;
00145       UINT8                                           ubDensity;
00146       UINT8                                           ubNumberOfTiles;
00147       UINT32                                          fFlags;
00148       UINT16                                          usStructureNumber;
00149       UINT8                                           ubWallOrientation;
00150       INT8                                            bDestructionPartner; // >0 = debris number (bDP - 1), <0 = partner graphic 
00151       INT8                                            bPartnerDelta; // opened/closed version, etc... 0 for unused
00152       INT8                                            bZTileOffsetX;
00153       INT8                                            bZTileOffsetY;
00154       BYTE                                            bUnused[1];
00155 } DB_STRUCTURE; // 16 bytes
00156 
00157 typedef struct TAG_DB_STRUCTURE_REF
00158 {
00159       DB_STRUCTURE *                                                                      pDBStructure;
00160       DB_STRUCTURE_TILE **                                                    ppTile; // dynamic array
00161 } DB_STRUCTURE_REF;           // 8 bytes
00162 
00163 typedef struct TAG_STRUCTURE 
00164 {
00165       struct TAG_STRUCTURE *                    pPrev;
00166       struct TAG_STRUCTURE *                    pNext;
00167       INT16                                                                         sGridNo;
00168       UINT16                                                                        usStructureID;
00169       DB_STRUCTURE_REF *                                    pDBStructureRef;
00170       union
00171       {
00172             struct
00173             {
00174                   UINT8                                                             ubHitPoints;
00175                   UINT8                                                             ubLockStrength;
00176             };
00177             struct
00178             {
00179                   INT16                                                             sBaseGridNo;
00180             };
00181       }; // 2 bytes
00182       INT16                                                                         sCubeOffset;// height of bottom of object in profile "cubes"
00183       UINT32                                                                        fFlags; // need to have something to indicate base tile/not
00184       PROFILE *                                                               pShape;
00185       UINT8                                                                         ubWallOrientation;
00186       UINT8                                                                         ubVehicleHitLocation;
00187       UINT8                                                                         ubStructureHeight; // if 0, then unset; otherwise stores height of structure when last calculated
00188       UINT8                                                                         ubUnused[1];
00189 } STRUCTURE; // 32 bytes
00190 
00191 typedef struct TAG_STRUCTURE_FILE_REF
00192 {
00193       struct TAG_STRUCTURE_FILE_REF *           pPrev;
00194       struct TAG_STRUCTURE_FILE_REF *           pNext;
00195       AuxObjectData *                                                         pAuxData;
00196       RelTileLoc *                                                                  pTileLocData;
00197       UINT8 *                                                                                   pubStructureData;
00198       DB_STRUCTURE_REF *                                                pDBStructureRef; // dynamic array
00199       UINT16                                                                                    usNumberOfStructures;
00200       UINT16                                                                                    usNumberOfStructuresStored;
00201 } STRUCTURE_FILE_REF; // 24 bytes
00202 
00203 // IMPORTANT THING TO REMEMBER
00204 //
00205 // Although the number of structures and images about which information
00206 // may be stored in a file, the two are stored very differently.
00207 //
00208 // The structure data stored amounts to a sparse array, with no data
00209 // saved for any structures that are not defined.
00210 //
00211 // For image information, however, an array is stored with every entry
00212 // filled regardless of whether there is non-zero data defined for
00213 // that graphic!
00214 typedef struct TAG_STRUCTURE_FILE_HEADER
00215 {
00216       CHAR8       szId[4];
00217       union
00218       {
00219             struct
00220             {
00221                   UINT16      usNumberOfStructures;
00222             };
00223             struct
00224             {
00225                   UINT16      usNumberOfImages;
00226             };
00227       };
00228       UINT16      usNumberOfStructuresStored;
00229       UINT16      usStructureDataSize;
00230       UINT8       fFlags;
00231       UINT8       bUnused[3];
00232       UINT16      usNumberOfImageTileLocsStored;
00233 } STRUCTURE_FILE_HEADER; // 16 bytes
00234 
00235 // "J2SD" = Jagged 2 Structure Data
00236 #define STRUCTURE_FILE_ID "J2SD"
00237 #define STRUCTURE_FILE_ID_LEN 4
00238 
00239 #define STRUCTURE_SCRIPT_FILE_EXTENSION "JSS"
00240 #define STRUCTURE_FILE_EXTENSION "JSD"
00241 
00242 #define STRUCTURE_FILE_CONTAINS_AUXIMAGEDATA          0x01
00243 #define STRUCTURE_FILE_CONTAINS_STRUCTUREDATA         0x02
00244 
00245 #endif
